v.v: See, my eye has seen all this;
What you know, the same I also know;
However, I would rather speak with the Almighty;
But you whitewash the truth with lies;
Oh, that you would altogether hold your peace!
Hear now my own reasoning;
Will you speak unrighteously for God,
Will you show him partiality?
Will it be good for you when he searches you out?
He would surely reprove you
Will not his majesty terrify you,
Your memorable sayings are proverbs made of ashes;
Hold your peace, let me alone, so that I may speak,
I will take my own flesh in my teeth;
See, if he kills me, I will have no hope left;
This will be the reason for my deliverance,
God, listen carefully to my speech;
See now, I have set my defense in order;
Who is the one who would argue against me in court?
God, do only two things for me,
withdraw your oppressive hand from me,
Then call me, and I will answer;
How many are my iniquities and sins?
Why do you hide your face from me
Will you persecute a driven leaf?
For you write down bitter things against me;
You also put my feet in the stocks;
although I am like a rotten thing that wastes away,

v: my ear has heard and understood it.
I am not inferior to you.
I wish to reason with God.
you are all physicians of no value.
That would be your wisdom.
listen to the pleading of my own lips.
and will you talk deceitfully for him?
Will you argue the case for God?
Could you deceive him as you might deceive men?
if in secret you showed partiality.
and the dread of him fall upon you?
your defenses are defenses made of clay.
let come what may on me.
I will take my life in my hands.
nevertheless, I will defend my ways before him.
for no godless person would come before him.
let my declaration come to your ears.
I know that I am innocent.
If you came to do so, and if I were proved wrong, then I would be silent and give up my life.
and then I will not hide myself from your face:
and do not let your terrors make me afraid.
or let me speak to you, and you answer me.
Let me know my transgression and my sin.
and treat me like your enemy?
Will you pursue dry stubble?
you make me inherit the iniquities of my youth.
you closely watch all my paths;
you examine the ground where the soles of my feet have walked
like a garment that moths have eaten.
